2.text: Add milk, cocoa, vanilla, and salt to the food processor.

3.text: Blend the ingredients for 30 to 45 seconds.

4.text: Chop 2 to 3 ounces (30 to 45 g) of chocolate into 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) pieces.

5.text: Microwave the chocolate in 20-second increments until it's melted.

6.text: Stir 1⁄4 cup (59 ml) of your choice of sweetener into the melted chocolate.

7.text: Scoop the melted chocolate into the avocado mixture.

8.text: Add coconut cream or a banana to the processor if you want to flavor the pudding.

9.text: Blend the pudding for 2 minutes or until it's completely smooth.

10.text: Chill the avocado pudding for 20 to 30 minutes before serving it.

11.text: Scoop the flesh from 2 pounds (0.91 kg) of avocados into a blender.

12.text: Put the sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice, and salt in the blender.

13.text: Blend the ingredients until they're smooth and transfer them to a mixing bowl.

14.text: Beat 1 1⁄2 cups (350 ml) of heavy cream in a separate bowl on high speed.

15.text: Fold the whipped cream into the avocado mixture until it's incorporated.

16.text: Pour the mixture into a 9 in × 5 in (23 cm × 13 cm) loaf pan and cover it with foil.

17.text: Freeze the ice cream for 6 hours before serving it.

18.text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C) and line a 9 in × 9 in (23 cm × 23 cm) pan.

20.text: Add 2 eggs, both types of sugar, cocoa, baking soda, salt, and vanilla to the blender.

21.text: Blend the brownie batter for 30 seconds.

22.text: Add 1 1/2 cups (262 g) of chocolate chunks and pour the batter into the pan.

23.text: Bake the brownies for 20 to 25 minutes.

24.text: Remove the brownies and cool them for 5 to 10 minutes before serving them.
